column4: Help! My move operation, done using Nautilus, of over 80GB data from one computer to another (via network) seems to have gotten stuck. Any idea how to troubleshoot?
network connectivity (i.e., ping) still work?
yes
i always find it safer to use rsync to transfer files over the network
yea, should've used that, retrospectively thinking. just aren't familiar with it.
it's fairly easy once you get your head around it :)
Can rsync be used to move also, not just copy?
yes, i believe so
also, it is simple enough to resume the broken transfer with rsync? In that case I could just cancel the current, stuck, one and pick it up with rsync
i think the --remove-source-files will do it
rsync can pick up broken rsync transfers easily
worse comes to worse, if it can't move it, you can always sync it, then rm -rf the source :P
yes. Well, let's see i guess.
true
So what would be the command to try and resume a transfer? Does this seem ok: rsync -rvh --remove-source-files me@host:sourcepath destinationpath
Hm, I mean: rsync -arvh --remove-source-files me@host:sourcepath destinationpath
i'd put a -P in there as well
puts partially transferred files - better for resuming later
and a -v
is there an option for removing source directories as well? I couldn't find.
directories wise, i couldn't see it either :(
yup, not a problem.
Is there a way to get rsync to first go through all the files, and then give me an estimate of transfer time?
none that I know of, no
